    13. Qxf4

    Bh3 and Rf1 wins if black does not play Ng4.

    13 ... Ng4

    14. e5

    14 ... Na6

    15. Bh3

    17. Rf3

    19 ... d5

    To stop Ne4.

    20. Ne4

    20 ... dxe4

    21. Rf1 g5

    22. Bg2

    19 ... Nb4

    20. Rf1 g5

    21. Ne4

    21 ... Nd3

    22. Rf8+ Kh7

    23. Bg2

    White has Nf6-Nxe5-Be4.

    23 ... d5

    24. exd6

    23 ... c5

    24. dxc5

    21 ... d6

    22. Bg2

    It's the same concept: Nf6-dxe5-Be4.

    22. exd6

    Alternatively, white may play exd6 and allow Nd5.

    22 ... Nd5

    23. Nd6
